channel.title: Easy Computer Clean (.bat code)
channel.description:
I've been using this for awhile and figured it could be useful to others. Simply copy the following code into a notepad and save it to desktop as clean.bat, cleanup.bat, kittens.bat, or whatever you desire and run it. It basically cleans out unnecessary data from useless files such as the %temp% file, prefetch, history, recent, cookies, etc... Don't worry, it does not delete anything important or useful. Add to the code, rewrite it to clean out other files, or take out lines for it to not clean out certain files. It seems to work wonders in making my computer faster. I'm sure there are better methods, but I'm just trying to help.
Code to copy into notepad > save as clean.bat to desktop > run it
[code]@echo off del /s /f /q c:\windows\temp\*.* rd /s /q c:\windows\temp md c:\windows\temp del /s /f /q C:\WINDOWS\Prefetch del /s /f /q %temp%\*.* rd /s /q %temp% md %temp% deltree /y c:\windows\tempor~1 deltree /y c:\windows\temp deltree /y c:\windows\tmp deltree /y c:\windows\ff*.tmp deltree /y c:\windows\history deltree /y c:\windows\cookies deltree /y c:\windows\recent deltree /y c:\windows\spool\printers del c:\WIN386.SWP rd /s %systemdrive%\$Recycle.bin cls [/code]
Edit: Added "rd /s %systemdrive%\$Recycle.bin" to clean out recycling bin. It will ask Y or N, so make sure you don't want to restore anything before you enter Y. Credits to AtomicInt_
Note: I am not the creator of this method, I take no credits.

item.title: Easy Computer Clean (.bat code)
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

Awesome, thanks.

OT: Anyone who want’s to contribute to the code, I’ll gladly add it in there with appropriate credits. Make it as helpful as possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Easy Computer Clean (.bat code)
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“nolan2131, post:6, topic:533487”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=652280.msg4370931#msg4370931 date=1380634646]
this deleted my special folder

OT: Thanks this could be very useful to those who need it.
[/quote]

:eek: Erase that line where your special folder is located! I hope you didn’t lose anything too valuable, it’s supposed to clean out useless junk files.[/quote]
It was sarcasm.

Read full topic

item.title: Easy Computer Clean (.bat code)
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

If you store your special folder in the temp file or any listed within the code, unfortunately they will be recognized as junk. It only keeps folders that the computer absolutely needs. Just an odd place to store a folder since the aforementioned files are virtually useless and unused in most cases.

Read full topic

item.title: Easy Computer Clean (.bat code)
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:3, topic:533487”] rd /s %systemdrive%\$Recycle.bin

Add to empty the recycle bin as well. It give you the Y/N option just in case.[/quote]

Added Good idea

item.title: Easy Computer Clean (.bat code)
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

I’ve been using this for awhile and figured it could be useful to others. Simply copy the following code into a notepad and save it to desktop as clean.bat, cleanup.bat, kittens.bat, or whatever you desire and run it. It basically cleans out unnecessary data from useless files such as the %temp% file, prefetch, history, recent, cookies, etc… Don’t worry, it does not delete anything important or useful. Add to the code, rewrite it to clean out other files, or take out lines for it to not clean out certain files. It seems to work wonders in making my computer faster. I’m sure there are better methods, but I’m just trying to help.

Code to copy into notepad > save as clean.bat to desktop > run it

@echo off del /s /f /q c:\windows\temp\*.* rd /s /q c:\windows\temp md c:\windows\temp del /s /f /q C:\WINDOWS\Prefetch del /s /f /q %temp%\*.* rd /s /q %temp% md %temp% deltree /y c:\windows\tempor~1 deltree /y c:\windows\temp deltree /y c:\windows\tmp deltree /y c:\windows\ff*.tmp deltree /y c:\windows\history deltree /y c:\windows\cookies deltree /y c:\windows\recent deltree /y c:\windows\spool\printers del c:\WIN386.SWP rd /s %systemdrive%\$Recycle.bin cls

Edit: Added “rd /s %systemdrive%$Recycle.bin” to clean out recycling bin. It will ask Y or N, so make sure you don’t want to restore anything before you enter Y. Credits to AtomicInt_

Note: I am not the creator of this method, I take no credits.
